column4: hello all, newb here, trying to setup phpmyadmin on my ubuntu 11.04 server and keep getting 404 errors. I've added the include to my apache.conf file but still no luck. can anyone help me out?
all you need to do is make a symlink from /etc/apache2/conf.d/ to point at /etc/phpmyadmin/apache.conf and then reload apache.
i've already done that as well
what url are you trying to load it with? (feel free to obsfucate the domain if its publically facing)
ls -ll /etc/apache2/conf.d/ shows "phpmyadmin.conf -> ../../phpmyadmin/apache.conf", is that not right?
thats right.  And the www-data user can read the file?
stupid questionâ€¦. how do i check? :)
Just paste the full output of ls -ll for that file.
you mean from where the symlink is or the actual real file?
the actual file, not the symlink. sure you can.
thats fine, and the permissions look fine too.
You installed phpmyadmin from the package repositories, right?
you've been a great help so far and i've got to run but any other things i should be checking?
